intro: Draba sonorae, commonly known as the Sonoran Draba, is a small flowering plant native to the Sonoran Desert. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments with limited water availability. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Draba sonorae is known for its resilience and is often found in areas with sparse vegetation.
